parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The content focuses on encouraging informed voting in general, not endorsing a particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message ("Don't leave the elections to chance!") is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for or against any particular candidate. The aim is to encourage voters to be informed and make a considered choice, which is not inherently a violation of electoral law. The website linked, eucucinevotez.eu, appears to be a resource for comparing candidates' platforms, further supporting this interpretation.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's style and content align with citizen journalism or public service announcements. It promotes civic engagement and informed decision-making, without advocating for any specific political party or candidate. The involvement of organizations like Konrad Adenauer Stiftung further suggests a non-partisan, educational intent.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes a non-partisan message encouraging informed voting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>532144223143223</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the electoral process, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post encourages informed voting but doesn't endorse any specific candidate or party.  Its objective is civic engagement, not influencing votes for a particular candidate. The content is consistent with educational and journalistic initiatives promoting informed participation in the democratic process.  The involvement of reputable organizations like Konrad Adenauer Stiftung further strengthens this interpretation.  There is no evidence of advising voters at polling stations or continuing electoral propaganda after its conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
